fieldsOfStudy: Legal Studies: Business and Corporate Law
educations.schoolName: University of San Diego School of Law

defaultPosition.description:
This position is with the Non-Detained Unit (NDU) located in San Diego field office. The duties require the incumbent to have access to classified files and materials that consist of enforcement of laws and regulations pertaining to the detention and removal of aliens. Major duties and responsibilities are listed below:

-Manages non-detained dockets, researches detainee history using multiple sources to establish identity and citizenship. Reviews and evaluates case documentation for inconsistencies. Prepares, processes, and delivers files to various stakeholders, e.g. Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR). Provides administrative support to the managers, supervisors or staff members by assisting in the day to day management of the officeâs activities, e.g. compiling and preparing information, making logistical arrangements for meetings, conferences, answering telephones.

-Collect, analyze, and evaluate data from law enforcement databases; compile data for submission to headquarters in response to task requests. Is responsible for summarizing and tabulating a variety of information and data for various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems. Accurately, consistently, and in a timely manner, enter all appropriate data in to agency indices, e.g. EARM, according to agency policy and procedures.

-Assist Deportation Officers in interviewing aliens, investigative sources, family members, and others, as appropriate.

-Develop and maintain relationships with other law enforcement agencies and country, State, Federal, and local detention facilities.

-Review bond cases and recommend continuing, canceling, or breaching bonds; prepares paperwork as determined by signatory official.

-Exercise quality control over bond paperwork: Verify source of payment, verify address, generate bond contract.

-Maintains documentation for travel or acquisitions, consistent with record keeping requirements. Coordinates escorts and transportation.
defaultPosition.title: Enforcement and Removal Operations

positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Operations

positions.description: Provide clients with armed protective services.
positions.title: Armed Guard

positions.description: As an armed supervisory staff for five multi-million dollar commercial contracts, our team developed and implemented improved security procedures. Applied loss prevention techniques and investigative procedures, which resulted in the reduction of stolen property and incident reports. We strategically assessed and recommended surveillance technology for critical areas, and establish policies for tracking and reporting missing inventory with log system.
positions.title: Security Officer

positions.description:
Provided armed security services at designated U.S. diplomatic and consular facilities, while providing protection for U.S. citizens and U.S. government properties. Additional duties consist of emergency response, funds management, operation coordination, training implementation, counterintelligence, and VIP support for visits by the POTUS, senior U.S. Government officials, and U.S delegations. MSG works in conjunction with the Department of State Regional Security Officers, U.S. Secret Service, and Local Guard Force.

Served in American Embassy San Jose, Costa Rica; Algiers, Algeria; and Beijing, China.
positions.title: Marine Security Guard

positions.description: The use of industry level cameras and non-linear editing systems to produce visual information documentation of training, military operation, surveillance, public affair, joint operation, and studio mission within the Department of Defense. Participated in the 2009 Lava Viper Exercise, 2010 Key Resolve Exercise in South Korea (as a security augment), and Rim of the Pacific 2010.
positions.location: Marine Corps Base Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii
positions.title: Combat Videographer

positions.description: Paid internship that helps in career preparation, work-readiness training, and academic enrichment.
positions.title: Summer Career Employment Program: Work Ready
